question: Which company has bagged the contract to build the longest river bridge of India, across Brahmaputra?
explanation:
The construction arm of Larsen and Toubro (L&T), L&T Construction has bagged the contract to build India's longest river bridge.
The 19-km long bridge, which is to be built across the Brahmaputra river, will connect Dhubri in Assam to Phulbari in Meghalaya. It will also improve connectivity of the North Eastern states with the rest of the country.
